Reviews.Title: “For Overnight Business Only”
Reviews.Author: Nellos
Reviews.Content: very noisy (behind the airport), rooms are reasonable size, internet access is good, breakfast buffet was minimal, gym was OK but nothing special, situated on the beach which is nice. I will try a hotel away from the airport next time

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Reward Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tvile619
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan for a few days and wanted to stay in different locations. So we used a reward certificate to stay at the Courtyard Mirimar. I'll admit the location is a little grimy. Its in a business district. But inside the hotel it was just fine.Very clean and the rooms were a nice size for two doubles. We are a family of 5 & we were just fine. We enjoyed the pool and a restaurant not far from the hotel(2 blocks)l. The staff recommended and it was great food .I walked around with ease during the day & night. Nobody bothers you. Overall a good spot based on other prices in San Juan ,

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: j o
Reviews.Content: Marriott's usually provide a consistent level of service and accomodation. This one disappointed. While the website advertised self parking on property - you have to put up with and pay for ($15 per day) for valet parking. And they double charged several parties including us for parking, which was slowing down checkout. They added a fee ($10.35) to our bill for a "hotel Tarriff". As far as we could see it was only added for Priceline customers, so it can be negotiated off the bill if you stick to your guns. The charge does not appear on the website. The building and rooms are truly wierd. The bathroom is built is such a way that the toilet seat will not stay up. I guess women may appreciate that. But figuring out how to flush the toilet is a real challenge, you have to get down on your knees and search. The shower curtain was not quite long enough, so there was no way to avoid a puddle on the bathroom floor. The bed was slanted, and very soft. There is only one elevator to serve about 10 floors. We were lucky to be on the second floor and could walk. But watch your head, the passageway won't accomodate a 6 foot person at some points. (In any real emergency, people are going to get hurt.) And, the pool is on the North or West side of the building, so it does not get sun most of the day. The area is a business area, definitely not a resort/vacation/beach/tourist area. That said, you can reach Old San Juan, or the Condado beaches in a short time. There are 2 or 3 decent restaurants in the neighborhood, plus 2 in the hotel. Allow 45-60 minutes for breakfast - they only cook one order at a time. The service staff was the redeeming point - quite up to Marriott standards. Too bad they are stuck with so little to work with.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one night stay before a cruise leaving from the Pan American Pier”
Reviews.Author: Sail2fun
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs an update and wireless internet. The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable about it area. The price was OK and the location was close to a couple of good restraints and a grocery store. I would not choose this hotel for a two night stay, but if you just need a room pre cruise, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK but front desk staff was not completely open with elevator noise.”
Reviews.Author: NavyAllan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an OK location but I wouldnâ€™t walk to far from the hotel after dark. It just didnâ€™t look and feel safe. There were street people and drunks less than two blocks from the hotel begging for money and drinking openly in broad day light. There were police patrolling in the area and when they were around it felt safer. The hotel only has valet parking that costs $15 a night and no self parking was offered. I ask for other parking options and was told I could park on the street but may not be safe and secure for the car. The hotel allowed the car to be checked in and out as many times I wanted and there were no problems with car damage or wait time. The restaurant was OK and the pool was OK. The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room had free internet. We upgraded to an executive room and was not worth the money because the front desk put us in Room 901 that was next to the elevator. When ask at check-in if the room was next to the elevator, we were told by the front desk person it was next to the elevator but we wouldnâ€™t be bothered with elevator noise. But we did hear the elevator all the time we were in the room especially at night going up and down. It sounded just like a jet taking off from inside an airport terminal. The front desk staff was aware that it stated inside my Marriott profile and because I told them that we wanted to be away from the elevator. If we were told the elevator could be annoying and heard inside our room we would have requested a different room. We were told on check-out by the Front Desk Manager it was the only room of that type in the hotel. I told her also if we would have known the elevator could be heard in the room and sounded like a jet taking off we would have change rooms. To her credit the manager did credit 4000 Marriott points to our account upon checkout but only after we ask for some type of compensation because they were misleading. Because I believe the Courtyard by Marriott in Miramar wanted to fill a room just to fill a room even if that means not being completely open with a quest even when directly ask the question about elevator noise I will never stay there again because "I DON'T LIKE TO BE MISLEAD" from the front desk staff upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Pre & Post Cruise Hotel Alright Stay”
Reviews.Author: King61256
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler for business and rack up the Marriott points pretty quick so for a 'free' room with points, I won't complain (much). With that being said, I was sort of disappointed in the hotel ROOM. The lobby, restaurant, and pool all were fine for a Courtyard hotel, but the rooms were not up to par. The shower head was dangling off the wall when we arrived, the window was filthy, and the walls are paper thin. HOWEVER - With that being said. The beds were comfortable and clean, TV had plenty of stations (not much to do in the area of which the hotel is located) and was big, pool is nice and the restaurant was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for night before cruise”
Reviews.Author: trabeler1
Reviews.Content: We (family of three) stayed here one night before a cruise and used Marriott points for the stay. Note that they have a $25 charge per person for more than 2 people, but waived the charge for children. Our room was clean, quiet, and the staff were very friendly. Other reviewers have complained about the elevator but we didn't have any issues. The hotel is not in the greatest neighborhood, but we never felt uneasy. There is a subway, papa johns, pharmacy, and grocery store nearby. Taxis were always available out front to go to the cruise terminal. Overall, we'd use this hotel again for a pre-cruise stay, but probably not if we wanted to spend more time in San Juan due to the inconvenient location relative to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: gbsand81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (arriving late) before a cruise. Staff was great, and rooms were adequate. We had two rooms -- one for the kids and one for parents -- and there seemed to be a size differential between the two. So you should check that out. Area around the hotel was OK, but not much going on. We did the breakfast package, which i would recommend (but stick with standard eggs instead of an omelette). A very short taxi ride from Pan American pier.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal property for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: geezer715
Reviews.Content: The staff was superb and seem to truly understand the basic wants and needs of their guests who are there for a brief visit. Solid, uneventful, comfortable stay. The convenient 24 mini market was nice, as was the breakfast restaurant. The star was "Augusto's", a landmark San Juan restaurant right at the hotel. A bit expensive, but worth it. Short taxi ride to Old Town. The following day, short taxi ride to the pier. Recommend this hotel primarily to pre-cruisers, and those on a longer stay tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best option for Marriott's in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: CDE32648
Reviews.Content: Hi- We stayed here for 1 night and that was plenty. there was a single, small elevator for 10+ floors of guests. We were on the 7th floor and ended up taking the stairs. The room was clean but looked beat up. Nice little pool. The area was run down. The desk staff were great and I felt bad for them - I'm sure they get lots of complaints. Not up to the usual standard of Courtyards. We had relatives that stayed in the other Courtyard in San Juan and they loved it! Swim-up bar, etc. Wish we had stayed there......

Reviews.Title: “Decent for one night”
Reviews.Author: MissBeachy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a group for night night prior to a cruise. I recommend as a good stay for this type of thing. The front desk was very friendly and the room was clean. The front desk held our luggage for us until we could go to board the ship. There was not anything real exciting within walking distance so for a long stay might not be as convienent. Was only 5 min or so driving distance to ship port. We ate breakfast in the restraunt and although it was a little slow it was decent food.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls Are Hard To Overcome”
Reviews.Author: NomadDiva
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the San Juan Miramar Courtyard. Both visits were for one night before a cruise. As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is not located in a touristy area. We were able to go for a walk and find a grocery store down the street for snacks and some pre-made sandwiches. But for the most part, options within walking distance are limited. The rooms are spacious and clean, but they have thin walls. Our room during our first visit was by the elevator, the noise kept us up all night. Our second visit I specifically requested to be away from the elevator. Man, I would have given my right eye to listen to the elevator that night. We had a roomful of rowdy boys above us. They were up rough housing and laughing until 3am. We called the front desk and had them intervene, but that didn't help. We thought we'd have the last laugh when our crying toddler woke them up in the morning, but those boys were up bright and early making all sorts of noise. When checkout rolled around, we packed up and headed for the elevator. Yes, singular. There is one elevator for the entire hotel, all 10 floors. Checkout time is completely absurd. We waited as it stopped at every floor going up, then every floor going down. Every time it reached us it was stuffed full of people. With three bags and a stroller, the stairs were not an option. After 10 minutes we decided desperate times called for desperate measures. Despite being on the third floor, we pressed the up button. We got on the elevator and stopped at every floor going up, filling up around floor five, then turned people away as we stopped at every floor going down. Just getting from our room to the lobby took 20-25 minutes. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Despite a lobby jammed with people, the restaurant was fairly empty. It was here that we got our first taste of "island time". With three waitstaff on duty it took almost two hours for us to order and eat pancakes. There were only people at three tables! Now, we weren't in a hurry because we couldn't get on our cruise ship until early afternoon, so we didn't mind a slow-paced meal. But being a fast-paced, typical American, I found it frustrating. It must be said, that once our meal did arrive, it was delicious. My husband ordered the macadamia nut butter pancakes, which were so fabulous we've been trying to replicate the recipe since we arrived home. The staff was very nice and accommodating to my toddler, and we got unlimited, free sippy cup refills. Despite our negative experiences, I don't have a terrible opinion of the San Juan Miramar Courtyard. The staff has always been very friendly and helpful, the food is delicious if you've got time and patience to spare, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Just bring earplugs and be ready to huff it on the stairs (or avoid checkout at the peak time).

Reviews.Title: “Another pre-cruise review”
Reviews.Author: brentwoodmom56
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the other reviewers that this is a great place to stay pre-cruise. Check in and check out were both very friendly and efficient and it was very busy. They will store your luggage after you check out - they had a large group checking in post cruise so they had more luggage than you can imagine. Despite all the luggage, they were very careful about keeping all luggage secure, which I was a little concerned about. The pool is very small and only 6 lounge chairs, so don't plan to spend an entire day at the pool. The restaurant was ok, food was food and service was not great - I was told that the hotel did not own the restaurant. I would recommend walking down to Lima - much better food and service. The rooms were not that big, but were very clean and our bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Cheesecake35
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for a pre-cruise in February 2012. The Hotel is clean, the rooms are specious and have all the amenities. The front desk staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. The Hotel is not located in Old San Juan, but in a business area, not much to do around, however, the public transportation is at 2 steps from the front door. The city bus are clean, runs frequently (never had to wait more than 10 minutes, any time of the day, night or weekend), and it's about 12 minutes ride at 50 cents per ticket (yes, very cheap!) and will drop you right in Old San Juan. Never saw 'weird' people in the bus, even at 8pm at night. Puerto Ricans are friendly and polites people, nothing to worry about. If you are looking for a nice and clean hotel, and not expecting a resort with a nice and big pool, this hotel will probably fit your desire. I would go back again if I happen to be in San Juan for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay...”
Reviews.Author: TheRule
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in San Juan without pre-booking a hotel so we did the price "negotiation" through another site and fortunately wound up here. In summary, we were pleased enough with this hotel that we booked a second night directly with the hotel staff. Regarding location, it's not on the beach and it's not in Old San Juan, but it's no more than 10 minutes to these sites so actually it's very well situated. And it's just a block or two from highway 26 so it's an easy juant to the airport and other destinations. There is not a lot to do right where this hotel is located so that may be a turn-off for those wanting to walk to shops or restaurants. And, there are some unsavory neighborhoods not all that far from here so if you need the feeling of luxury and security all around, again, this might not work for you. But truly, Marriott is smart enough not to stick a "Courtyard" in a bad area so I really don't think there is any worries here. And, I came to realize that many neighborhoods around San Juan and beyond all have an element of appearing run-down. However, by the end of our first trip to Puerto Rico, I felt extremely safe. Arriving at the hotel...well, it's a one-way street so if you approach on Ponce de Leon and the hotel is on your left, then you are going the wrong way and are likely to be in a bus-lane. As far as I could see, the only option for parking is to turn into the hotel entrance and leave your car with the valet. I never saw where they took my car but that was fine because I didn't want to park it on the street. The parking was $15/day and I tipped a couple bucks when they parked it. This appears to be the norm throughout most of the metro area so no complaints here. I never quite figured out the methodology of the valet attendants as it seemed to differ the two days we were there. Nevertheless, our car was brought up quick enough so no complaints. Inside, the front desk staff were exceptionally friendly. It's amazing how a pleasant attitude makes such a difference. They set us up on the 10th floor in a single bed room and although the room was not huge, it was clean as a whistle and updated. We really have nothing to complain about. The maid service in the morning was great. I left a few bucks and came back from our day adventures to find our belongings nicely arranged, including our toothbrushes set on towels. Again, no complaints. We did NOT take advantage of the pool and restaurant area so we can't comment on that. Overall, I have to give this hotel an "excellent" rating because it met all of our expectations. IF you are here on vacation and are wanting to be in the midst of Old San Juan or right next to the beaches, then maybe look elsewhere. But if you are good with anything or here on business, then I think you'll be fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “As many have said before this hotel has a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: mickstang
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to leaving on a cruise. If you're looking for a resort type hotel this isn't it. On the other hand if you're looking for a nice clean hotel with a truly wonderful staff and a great little bar/restuarnt at a reasonable price this is the place. It was perfect for spending a relaxing evening before heading out on the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but watch for bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Sandi106
Reviews.Content: Checked in after doing the walking tour of Old San Juan. Decided to take a short nap before dinner. We woke up and found a bed bug in the sheets. I had a bite on my leg. Went to the desk to tell them, and they were horrified. Immediately sent two housekeeping staff to our room to investigate, helped us move (upgraded to a suite), kept checking with us to make sure all was good, sent snacks and drinks to our room, and antibiotic ointment & bandages for the bite. I have to say, they were very concerned and bent over backwards to try and make it right. The suite room had no bugs, so it all worked out fine, but I'd definitely check under the covers first before getting into a bed there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with pool area”
Reviews.Author: NanaBoop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live on the otherside of the island and going to San Juan for a getaway weekend for New Years was why we planned the trip. A pool for us is a real deal breaker and this hotel's pool literally has a one hour window of sun all day in the pool area. Who designed this place? if the pool was placed on the other side of the building the pool would have had sun all day. If you are going to this hotel expecting to get any sun you will be sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accomodations in downtown San Juan”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller010111
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly nice hotel in downtown San Juan a few minutes by car to the beach (Condado) as well as Old San Juan. It has the basic amenities expected of a international hotel chain and is clean with good service. It has two restaurants where one can eat but San Juan has so many restaurants that the traveller has a lot of choice. The only downside is that although there is free wired internet in the rooms there is no Wi Fi in the rooms. Wi Fi is available for free in the hotel reception area but that can be a pain to drag your computer there. This is a big downside if one wishes to use Wi Fi enabled devices such as IPAD. I cannot understand why this hotel does not provide Wi Fi in the rooms. Other than that I have no complaints. The staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel is located in a safe area - an important consideration for families with little children or even solo travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Downtown San Juan Miramar”
Reviews.Author: zanezed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before catching a cruise out of San Juan. This hotel was cheaper than the resort hotels and does not have a resort fee like others in San Juan. The hotel is nice and clean, well kept but nothing fancy. The king room was ok, as was the bathroom. The window, which was once a sliding door now fixed shut, is not completely sealed and thus there is quite a bit of noise that comes through from rain and the street below - thats why I give this hotel an average rating. The internet in the room and in the lobby works fine. Pool looks nice, didn't have time to use it. Hotel over all is clean, and the staff are professional. The best part of this hotel was the Bistro - the food was really really good, as were the coffees and capuccinos. We had dinner and breakfast there. We did not try the fine dining restaurant also in the hotel. The parking is valet - the guys are fast and friendly - parking is $15 plus tip. Hotel is close to expressway access to go shopping at Las Plaza Americas and not too far from the port for cruise ships or Candano car rental drop off (Charlie's).

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeng6109
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and sister. We found the hotel to to be clean and the staff was very helpful. You could catch a bus to town as it is too far to walk. Stayed prior to going on a cruise and was satisified with hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Don't Stay There”
Reviews.Author: odalis729
Reviews.Content: Terrible location, terrible location, did I mention terrible location. Prostitutes 2 blocks from the hotel, did not feel safe there. Not friendly at all. Made a reservation with Priceline.com, was not informed by them that there was going to be an additional hotel tariff charge at the hotel ($7.04 per day) when I inquired with Priceline, I was informed that upon their investigation it was for energy surcharges, newspaper delivery fees, in-room safe fees, tourism fees, or housekeeping fees and/or certain optional incidental fees, for example, parking charges, minibar charges, phone calls, room service and movie rentals, hotel service fee etc. This hotel was not a resort, there were no newspaper delivered, no minibar, made no phone calls, did not use room service or rented any movie...a real rip-off. Valet parking took for ever, two of the day waited more than 20 minutes because they didn't know where they parked the car and so on. Did i mention terrible location!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a good selection”
Reviews.Author: jllantin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business related. They have valet parking with good attention employees. It is very accessible to old San Juan and shopping areas. They have two nice restaurants (one high end, "Augustos" where you can enjoy a great dining experience) and the other one Brasserie 801, both offering International food. They also offer complimentary Internet connection, working desk with ergonomic chair on every room and Fitness Room.

Reviews.Title: “very happy here”
Reviews.Author: sunray712
Reviews.Content: Cancelled a reservation and chose here after a cruise. This was a great location and very nice desk personel. She checked us in about 11AM...we were tired for getting off the ship. Room (601) very nice and accommendating. Wi-fi and 3 computers in lobby which was very nice. The cafe inside was expensive(wouldn't visit there more than once). Waiters were slow and not very caring but I would return to this hotel. Nice pool and very clean. Good work space in room with coffee maker and small fridge. Grocery store, pharmacy, and restaurants 3-4 blocks away. Taxis wait outside to take you around. Ten minutes to airport. Taxi charges $15 and then $1 per bag. We took a taxi tour around the city, Old San Juan is very nice--$35 for 1 hour and the 3 of us couldn't get the driver to stop for some quick shopping. Historic sites were also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic atmosphere, great fitness room, restaurant, and bar.”
Reviews.Author: lmessick
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great pools, great lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesReviews
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel, at a fair price. It was in town, but not a touristy area. You need to take transportation (taxi, rental car or city bus) anywhere. You can catch the city bus out on the street. It's a short jaunt to Old San Juan. Personally I would prefer to stay in a different location as a tourist. On the flipside, local shops are nearby (such as pharmacies, groceries, etc. and restaurants). It wasn't my favourite place in P.R. Our hotel was standard; nothing fancy and nothing offensive. The pool area was clean and small.Towels were provided at the pool. Nobody was swimming or lounging there.

Reviews.Title: “Would only stay here again in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: WpgFoodie101
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very close to the airport, so its a good option if you have an early flight out of San Juan. Check in at this hotel was great, staff was really helpful and friendly. Get off the elevator on my floor and immediately could tell that this hotel was old and worn out. Enter my room and my door doesn't close all of the way. Open the closet door to get out the luggage rack and there is filth in the closet tracks. Carpets were stained and old and starting to come apart from the wall. I was staying here for work and really didn't have any other options, but if I came here on a personal trip, I can tell you that I wouldn't have stayed. Good news is that there were no bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business traveller hotel”
Reviews.Author: THEB-traveler
Reviews.Content: No need to pay more for a good resting night after a long day working. Clean rooms, friendly staff and very good security. It have a gas station around the corner and some eating places at walking distance. Because of location you are always against the traffic. Great choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What happened to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: JTsobe
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Courtyard Property. The hotel was in good shape, the room was nice and comfortable, and the location was adequate for a first time tourist like me. However, upon checking in found out that their elevator was broken, so me as a guest will have to use the service elevator. Elevator didnt become functional until next day, so it was very hard to use the service elevator because of the other guests and the employees at the same time. My room didnt have any soap, shampoo, etc. I have to ask housekeeping for these items. These items are essential for this kind of hotel or any hotel. The rooms have coffee maker and coffee; however no cream or sugar available in the room. Overall, my stay was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Up to Marriott's Standards”
Reviews.Author: e2637
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one day prior to a cruise departing from San Juan. I am a huge fan of the Marriott brand but found this particular hotel to be operated at a lesser standard than the norm. I was disappointed by the lack of a working deadbolt lock AND safety latch on the door. It was after midnight when we first noticed this issue and I called down to the reception desk. The night desk attendant offered no solution. We blocked the door with a chair (picture included). The hotel room was small but clean. The hotel isn't in walking distance to tourist spots but most areas were easy to access with our rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: lozana36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family: parents and children. It was a lovely stay and the staff was very helpful. Beach isn't close but there are nice restaurants nearby. Skip the hotel food. It's good but the service is SLOW. There are cheap places to eat nearby. There is a nice Peruvian restaurant nearby as well but its pricey and the service is slow. A local Boricuan eatery serves a cheap breakfast with the works. They speak some English. This hotel is about convenience (close to piers for cruise) but the kids spent HOURS in the pool. Didn't encounter an unfriendly face anywhere for the three days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: psun21
Reviews.Content: I mainly agree with all of the reviews. I wanted to also emphaze to be prepare that the walls were paper thin. You can hear EVERTHING! We stayed one night before catching our cruise and wasn't able to get any sleep due to hearing the neighbors all night/morning long. At least the bed was comfy and the front desk was able to hold your luggage, while you check out the city. We felt that the location was a bit "hoody" but it was ok enough to roam around during the day. The hotel was on the bus line, which is the cheapest and efficient way to get to Old San Juan (in our opinion). Although I don't think that I would recommend the bus to a woman traveling alone. However, it only costed $2.00 round trip. Overall it was affortable (compared to other hotels near the cruise terminal), and decent enough for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Would expect the hotel to be under $100 per night @ this location”
Reviews.Author: lbindc73
Reviews.Content: A bid on priceline.com put us at this hotel, and we were largely disappointed, mainly because of the location. I did not feel comfortable on this street after dark, and the beach is a good 30 minute walk away that includes a road going under the highway. We drove everywhere. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast in the cafe downstairs was good, but I felt like everything was super overpriced given the part of town we were in. The staff were very nice, but I would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JetsForFunJourneys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a layover. It is about 15 minutes from the airport (depending on traffic) and located in a high-rise area. Yes, the area is not ideal, but not bad by any means. There are several restaurant options nearby including fast food. The room was very tidy. We stayed on an upper floor and had continuous hot water for whatever reason. However I'm sure it was a minor glitch. Both the arrival and departure staff were very friendly and helpful. The taxi ride is a fixed $16 to/from the airport (including fuel surcharge.) Taxis are parked right out front for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, fair location”
Reviews.Author: MidWestTraveller06
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Courtyard San Juan Miramar; we had two rooms--one for self and wife; one for two adult children travelling with. We were on our way to a cruise and wanted to see some of Puerto Rico. The hotel was reasonably clean, rooms neither large nor luxurious. It kind of sits on the border of a rather run down area and a nicer area. The service in the less formal dining facility was horrid, but the food--once you got what you ordered--was fine. we did not try the more expensive restaurant. It is not particularly convenient to anything, although it is a fairly easy drive to Old San Juan. Most of the front desk staff was very good to work with. The business center had one computer that actually worked for internet access while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.”
Reviews.Author: ginamarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. Hotel was clean. Staff was great. However, the mattress we slept on was worn and seemed old. My 20 year old daughters bed was fine. But our bed was so uncomfortable, they put that nice bedding on an old springy mattress. Also, the ironing board was old and stained. So, the hotel was a mixture of nice Marriott quality and poor furniture/accessories. There were several places to eat within walking distance and snacks available to buy in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a one night stay before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: djkBuf
Reviews.Content: This hotel had nice rooms. I stayed here the night before my cruise and got the room off of priceline for $90. It very close to old San Juan. We could see the Carnival ship we were going on from the room. YES the hotel has only one very slow elevator but I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I really appreciated all their help”
Reviews.Author: stxvisitor
Reviews.Content: I really really enjoyed staying at this hotel. I had to be in San Juan for a month because my mother was having surgery at a nearby hospital. They not only accommodated my constant change in dates that I was checking out but also accommodated my mother checking in and out from day to day. They also asked about her every day I came in and really helped us through a difficult time. My room was very large, though I did notice it was larger than most on our floor. Maybe that's because I have very high "mileage" with Marriott. I didn't find the neighborhood a problem, but I've lived in South America, Europe, the Caribbean and traveled all over Asia and Africa. A couple of homeless people aren't really a big deal. As a woman, I went running around the lagoon after dark and never felt unsafe. This island is very populated and there are lots of poor people. I've had homeless people beg from me in downtown Orlando! *GASP* poor people in the Magic Kingdom??? Get over it people. Do your research before you go somewhere. I do think the Valet is expensive and slow and the restaurant is also pricey, but the food was at least good. The high speed internet is also pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Not great , but very good”
Reviews.Author: MrBusinessFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a little modernization even though while on my stay they where removing the 50's TV 's and getting nice plasmas that was definitely an A+, internet is not so high speed but it works would love to have Wi-Fi throughout the hotel ,the lobby is welcoming but needs a bar because they do have a bar inside the restaurant but it is sooo overprice that is better to just walk a block to the Pueblo supermarket and buy a Medalla six pack I think that if they add this for us the business travelers it would be a great relief ,they have a couple restaurants near the area safe to walk around since there is a lot of security (police) close to everything and easy to go from the hotel to the principal highways that take you everywhere and San Juan, really clean specially the room .The front desk staff was really helpful even at rush hour specially on Sunday morning they still manage to treat you with great respect and always with a smile My special thanks to Damaris and Enid that will always make me want to come back to the front desk because of their great way of treating me and my colleagues ... Moses was great giving directions ..Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best!”
Reviews.Author: Luchowa
Reviews.Content: Let's start by reviewing the good aspects of the hotel. The bed is great!! good night sleep, somehow quiet area. Yet, this is not a hotel that should cost more than $100 dollars (I paid $159). This is why: 1- Lack of attention to details. TV signal is weak and you can barely see the image (hey we are in 2011, how hard is to get an antenna??); light in the gym is not working, every 5 minutes it cycles on and off. 2- Service in the restaurant is terrible. I ask for a newspaper and they told me they didn't have one, I step out to the lobby and they had several (lobby is 10 ft from restaurant); I told the waitress that I didn't eat any carbs, so please take out the bread and potatos, and yet he ignored all I said; I ask to refill my water glass 4 times and it never happened. 3- Internet is very slow. I am trying to be loyal to Marriott and stay in their properties, yet this one makes it very hard....

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Having Your Own Apartment!”
Reviews.Author: GringaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I am completely baffled by the other reviews I've seem for this property as this is a great spot for a solo traveler, cruise ship visitors or business people. I stay here often because I know that Front Desk Staffers Dimaris and JesÃºs will do their best to guide me toward places of interest in the area, listen to my end-of-day adventure stories and make sure that I'm getting the most out of my stay at the property they are proud to work in. As far as room size, they're not small and the standards are HIGH when it comes to cleanliness in both the hotel rooms, hallways and at their pool which, oftentimes, you can enjoy all to yourself. This hotel IS somewhat of a business hotel and so no, there are no communal areas to meet other guests and fraternize and I agree, the group that runs the hotel's very overpriced restaurant must think I don't know that local breakfast haunt "La Pradera" is the best spot to "feel" like a local when grabbing a stool at the counter and watching the short-order cook whip up everything from eggs/cheese on pressed-toast to the most wonderful Papaya Batida's. There's also another 24-hour local haunt a block away from the hotel called "Los Pinos" which offers Dominican Food and drinks at very affordable prices. The movie theatres on this street offer tix at prices far lower than in the US so I always catch a few flicks there. This hotel has been my home-away-from-home many times and I hate to see people write such negative reviews because they were expecting a vacationer's kind of spot, that's really not what it is, it's a place where you will feel like a native/local to PR. It's for adventurers like me who like to rent a scooter and zip around, take the ferry to CataÃ±o more than once just to hang out on the Bacardi grounds, take the local bus to PiÃ±ones and buy $1 Medalla Light Beers while returning at the end of the day to a clean and safe home with a gorgeous marble lobby and having the Front Desk staff greet me by name EVERYTIME with a smile and an interest in how my day went on their beautiful island! That's what matters most to me.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL Rooms, Bad Area!!”
Reviews.Author: franklinmilford
Reviews.Content: Agree with prior travelers, room unbearably small. My co-worker got a suite, so after complaining to front desk, I was upgraded the next night, as we were there for 10 days. There is a restaurant on premise, but bad service and overpriced food will make you look elsewhere, except there is nothing nearby but Dominos!!! Bad neighborhood, front desk advised us not to go walking around, and we had to go through a police line into hotel one day. No parking, so you will gladly pay their fee if you want you rental car in same shape you got it(horribly dented,dinged and dirty). This hotel is near nothing. The streets have no names and the buildings have no numbers. Not impressed with this area at all.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PDS63
Reviews.Content: His hotel was earlier known as Excelsior. Best description is that of an average business hotel. Rooms are small,hardly any gap between the end of the bed and the TV unit. One needs to squeeze through. Same situation with the work table. Otherwise neat and clean. Nice lobby and a good food at the coffee shop. The specialty restaurant is good, but very expensive. The front office staff looked stretched, managed to mix up the laundry to my exasperation. Overall, a mixed experience! The location is also not something to write home about, hardly any place to entertain oneself if one were to step out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip could have been perfect if it weren't for this extreme disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jomommy
Reviews.Content: The walls were paper-thin. We could hear the elevator shaft even though our room was all the way down the hall, any conversation in the hallway and every door closing on our floor at all hours. There is an additional $7/per day "surprise" fee. No parking unless you pay the $15/day valet fee--every time we went to retrieve our car the valets were no where to be found. When they finally appeared they acted put upon and made us late for every event. We were there 4 days and not once did we enjoy a hot shower--two mornings it was luke warm, another it was flat out frigid. The restaurants are super expensive and don't even think about using the Market Place-- $2 for water and $2.25 for a candy bar that would normally cost you a buck or less. If you book thru Priceline you are guaranteeing yourself lousy service and only double beds---no kings for those of us staying in town to enjoy the city---those special rooms are reserved for the "cruise" guests arriving for only one night. Bottom line---you can survive the night, but wish you had skipped it all together. You will be nickled and dimed all the while the staff is giving you a "like it or leave it" smile.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make any plans to enjoy PR if you stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Madd-Angel
Reviews.Content: The help at the front desk were the worst, most unorganized and unprofessioal group of individuals in any hotel/resort that I have ever been to in my life! My hubby & I were only staying in PR for 1 day and cruising w/Celebrity the next (for a week). A few weeks prior to my stay, I called ahead & requested an early check-in & late check-out, being that our flight's arrival time was 11:30 am and the ship depart time the following day was after 7pm. I was informed by the hotel personnel that my request would be granted, however, when we arrived at the hotel at 12pm, we were told that no such request was entered in their system. We ultimately ended up waiting until 4pm for our room and we were not the only guests in limbo FOR HOURS. Before getting a room, we decided to grab a bite and we caught a bus to Old San Juan to walk around. When we returned, the lobby was still overcowded with waiting guest AND luggage. We were exhausted after a long flight & just wanted to shower & change & enjoy our 1 day in PR... To add insult to injury, the hotel staff were discourteous & rude. One had the audacity to offer us a "full breakfast upgrade" in the end, knowing that we already paid for it. I guess she assumed that we were as stupid as she looked... Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grvdggr71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-February for one night prior to a Southern Caribbean cruise. Rooms were very clean, if a little small. Good customer service at the front desk. Only real downside is there is only one elevator. Otherwise, no problems and would definitely recommend for a pre or post cruise stay. $15+$1/bag from SJU to this hotel, and $12 to Old San Juan via taxi, just FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Business Place”
Reviews.Author: Maizy72
Reviews.Content: Only stay in this place if your in town for business. Room service was awful, the place was noisy, room are really small, wifi doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: momma43
Reviews.Content: I arrived in San Juan at 12:00 and attempted to check in early. I was told to come back at 3:00 needless to say the room was not ready. Had to wait in lobby for an extra 40 minutes with tons of luggage all over the place. Room order was for 2 queens and I got 1 king and my firend had to sleep on roll out. Just terrible. Eat at Mike's the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: CraigPenney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Juan the night before leaving on a Caribbean cruise. Pros - clean room. Cons - ridiculous waits for the one small elevator, very poor breakfast service (we found a good, cheap 24 hour restaurant a couple of blocks away), nothing neighbourhood. With taxi fare to the cruise dock factored in, we should have paid a little more and stayed in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “How Do I Love Thee? Mucho!!!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: Seems I often get this property when bidding on a three-star and up bid and I couldn't be happier. I am a frequent visitor to PR and I like that this hotel has a WONDERFUL staff (Shout out to the Front Desk Team of Enid, Ayneris, JesÃºs y Dimaris)! The cleanliness factor is A+! Free usage of lobby computers are a great asset when researching restaurants (must say, the in-house one's are grossly overpriced for what you get, sad to say) but across the street is a wonderful simple place for a very inexpensive breakfast of Papaya or Mango Shakes (Batida's) or Pressed Toast with Eggs & Cheese. It's all locals there and it's authentic Miramar. The pool at the hotel is super clean and seldom used but it's open til 11PM and late night swims are fun. The hotel rooms all feature refrigerators and they'll loan you a microwave on request (they even have a mini-snack shop in their lobby that's open 24/7 for Popcorn, Candy, Muffins, Tuna Cans, etc and there's a large Pueblo Supermarket one block away. It's about a 5-minute ride to Old San Juan and the local "Escombron" Beach but you have many beaches to choose from in San Juan. Taxi's are always lined up in front and there's even an inexpensive popular 24-hour spot for Drinks/Food called "Cafe Los Pinos", very casual. If you want to use this as a jump off spot for day-trips and visits to El Yunque and Bacardi and Beaches, I can highly recommend this wonderful impressive looking hotel with it's staff that will ALWAYS greet you each time with a warm welcome. This, to my mind, is one of the most well-managed mid-sized hotels in San Juan! I travel alone often and I feel like this is home to me.

Reviews.Title: “I may never even stay at a Marriott again”
Reviews.Author: txhawk36
Reviews.Content: First off, upon checking in, we were advised there was a $100 per night incidental charge. We only work off Debit cards and tried to explain that $700 couldn't be held out of our debit card. She "compromised" and only held out $500. Considering we were using a debit card, this really put a damper on funding for our trip. Then, we get to the room, and other than a TV and fridge ... there is nothing you can really even spend $100 a night on ... there is no minibar, so unless we did nothing but sit in our rooms all vacation and pay preview porn ... no way would you be able to spend that much money. On more than one occasion we tried to get assistance from the front desk, but they never seemed to have a direct answer for our problem. For instance we asked for a rollaway when an extra family member got there. First we were told it would be taken care of, upon returning and no bed we were told housekeeping was closed. The next day we were told it was against fire codes. The walls in the hotel are super thin, you could hear the elevator from all the way down the hall. You could hear the next door room tv and voices, so I'm sure they heard ours. The neighborhood, OMG, those saying it is fine must have some pretty strong blinders on. Thank goodness I didn't have my children with me. The streets were filled with homeless people begging for money. Not even two blocks down after dark there were plenty of prostitutes congregating. Well it was Sunday maybe they were dressed to the nines for a late church service on the corner. There are businesses with food and such but after dark you have to deal with the shady characters to get there. As a female, no way I'd go out alone after dark. Oh then there are the restaurants, if paying $17 dollars for a burger in fries is your style...go for it. I didn't make this reservation, but my sister Pricelined it and we paid $100 a night! Totally not worth the money at all. We might as well of paid $200 a night since they held that extra hundred out anyway, and been in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “good for me”
Reviews.Author: ide05
Reviews.Content: you get what you paid for, the only thing that i complain about its that you can hear the people talking on the hallways, there wasnt to much people on my floor, not that i notice, but besides that and the parking that you have to pay every day 15 USD, Ok for me

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised With "CBM-Miramar"!”
Reviews.Author: RedCarnationReady
Reviews.Content: I visit San Juan often and to be honest, I'm not thrilled with the prospect of staying on the Isla Verde strip, I think it's tacky and yet for families, I guess it's convenient to have restaurants in walking distance, if you want overpriced tourist spots or fast food chains. Not for me. The Courtyard by Marriott-Miramar is near the bus route to Old San Juan and for adults who seek peace and quiet after a long day of touring, I say this is ideal. It's not a resort but it does have an outdoor pools and restaurants inside so there's enough to do here at night if a calm respite is what your after. I felt like a local here coming home to my private apt in the Miramar section. Sure, it's not a bad idea to rent a car but parking in Old San Juan is a hassle on weekend nights and cabs and buses are plentiful. The hotel will help arrange escorted daytrips to El Yunque Rainforest or the Camuy Caves for you. If your somewhat familiar with the "lay of the land" in San Juan, you see the value in this property. The only thing that wd enhance this property would be a complementary breakfast or room service but, you'd be smart to just head to Old San Juan to "La Bombanera" and enjoy breakfast at the counter with the locals and enjoy a Majjorca Pastry & a Cafe con Leche. Anyway, exhaust yourself touring all of PR and then collapse here at the CBM-Miramar. The staff will surely make you feel welcome. I got my room through a priceline bid and it was a great bet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Cincy_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott San Juan Miramar was a nice hotel. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small. The parking fees were reasonable. There were no "resort fees". The staff was nice. There were coin washers & dryers in the basement, which was very handy. Internet was free. The business center was free to guests. The great thing about staying here was that it was a short walk to local stores--grocery, pharmacy, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place clean close to old san juan”
Reviews.Author: prissy1081
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days prior to cruise. Your staff member Wilfredo was one of the nicest and most welcoming people i have ever met. He helped us coming to san Juan early because of a massive snowstorm in the northeast and not ever seeing each other before, he knew me by my voice the next morning!!!! He is an asset to your company. The only dissppointment was Augustos, we had dinner there the night before we left. The host seemed very distant and catered to the regulars of the resturant and left us sitting for long periods of time while other diners where hovered over. We left feeling we did not belong in taht resturant. Other than that it was pleasant, we always stay with marriot when we travel Denise and Glenn

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good, restaurant needs more help...”
Reviews.Author: AZgolferMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to boarding our ship for a southern caribbean cruise. There were not many places to eat within walking distance of this hotel. It was clean and comfortable. We asked for late check out and were given until 1:00 PM which helped. We hung out in the lobby for about an hour until we took a cab to board the ship. We went down for a late breakfast at the hotel restaurant. We had a long wait (for two of us), sat forever before we got any coffee let alone a menu, finally placed our order and it never came. The hostess stopped by the see if we enjoyed our meal and was upset when we told her we had not even received it. The breakfast food was tasty but we should have ordered lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: arecibopr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families, big rooms, the bathrooms are a little small. Loved the location in Miramar, has a lot of restaurants nearby and even has a supermarket no more than a block away, The on-site restaurant is very nice and the staff is super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with new paint”
Reviews.Author: rj-mc2
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that has been repainted. Room was a nice size but the bathroom was tiny. To flush the toilet you had to shut the lid and reach under a shelf. Stay away from the Bistro Restaurant. Food is overpriced, small portions. We had fish and chips and a pasta dish. Cost was $68. Booked direct with Marriott. Book with breakfast. I had to prove to them I bought the breakfast and then they would only give me breakfast for one day of the two day stay. Stayed prior to a cruise. I would not recommend this to anyone going on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jett456
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before a cruise. The hotel was clean and very comfortable beds and not too far away from the port. There were restaurants and convenience stores in the neighborhood which is residential and business. I got this hotel on Priceline and paid only $70 so for the price it was well worth it. The hotels in Old San Juan were very expensive (over $170). If I were going to be staying for an extended vacation I would pick a hotel that was closer to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel; not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: fraudsnoop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard prior to cruise departure; part of cruise package. Nice enough, but a bit dated. Cheapest way to get to Old San Juan is via bus. Restaurant on-site was nice for breakfast. Has a small pool surrounded by buildings. Would have preferred a hotel closer to Old SJ. Would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights pre cruise & paid (bid) $115 on Priceline. The hotel then added a "tariff" of $10 something per day (how come Priceline?). There is nothing of interest in the immediate walking distance of the hotel. The hotel room itself was OK but the walls were paper thin--the TV in the next room could easily be listened to. During the night noisy guests were yelling in the hallways. The restaurant was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly + helpful staff, fair price, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: HilaryC3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location unless you want beach front! It is close to a supermarket, restaurants, direct bus route to old san juan town etc. The staff are very friendly and really helpful! The cost of our stay was great overall, I'd say very good value. The rooms are clean, and basic, but have a fridge and free internet in the rooms. There are two restaurants on site (although I never used them) and a mini-market for snacks. The pool is small but has long opening hours (6am-11pm) and was warm enough to swim in at that time at night! There is a small gym room which was adequate, plus a washing machine and dryer for guest use- very handy! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Pre or Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGeocat
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night post cruise. We booked on Priceline for $70 per night. I wasn't sure how the hotel would be as we stayed 3 days pre cruise at the Intercontinental San Juan. When the taxi pulled up I was pleasantly surprized. It is in a business disctrict but nice business' around hotel. There is a grocery store and some restaurants nearby. Beach is about 1 mile or a $10 taxi ride. When we entered the hotel I loved the decor. Bright Salmon colored cealing, Nice comfy couches to lounge in. Nice marble floors. The elevators are very slow for the number of guests staying here. When we checking in it was only 11 AM so they let us go onto a "Waiting list" for a room. They stored our luggage for us. We took a cab back downtonwn Old San Juan ( 7 Minutes or so ) When we came back at 3:00 PM our room was ready. I had booked two rooms and wanted them next to each other. The hotel was very busy when we checking in. Each of the reservation agents took their time with each guest. The luggage area is gaurdede by a bellman. Once it was our turn in line the agent checked us in and gave us two rooms on the 7th floor. She was so helpful and told us where to go eat, how to walk to the beach and what restaurants were at the hotel. She was very patient since they had a line behind us. The rooms are big as far as hotel rooms go. A lot larger than the rooms at the Intercontinental. Remember you are on a tropical locale so the windows do get fogged up from the air being on and the humidity outside. Great AC. Nice large bathroom. Nice bed with bedding. We thought the pool area was small but clean and nice. 2 restaurants, one fancy and one fairly fancy. We didn't eat at either one. We walked down the block to "Lima" and it was a good Puruvian Restaurant. Overall I would stay here again for a night or 2 but any longer it would be better to be closer to the beach and more restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: lugnutcity
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights with our 21 & 22 year old children. All of us enjoyed the hotel & the location. The Pueblo supermarket is across the street and food is abundant in the area. We frequently used the busses to Old San Juan, it was 50 or 75 cents apparently depending on the time of day. In normal traffic Old San Juan is a 5 to 10 minute bus ride. We didn't pay the $15 to park at the hotel, we parked our rental car on Trigo Street every day which is the street just to the east and had no problems. We enjoyed the fact that there were 2 washers & 2 dryers located in the basement available 24/7 altrhough they each cost $2 for 30 minutes. You can get quarters for the bus & laundry from the front desk. The elevator could be crowded at times but the stairway was convenient. We felt very safe walking in this neighborhood. There's a treadmill & TV in the basement also available 24/7. We never used the pool, it was small & shaded, why would you use the pool when you can go to the beach? We didn't eat at the 801 or Augusto's restaurants in the hotel, we were on a budget and both restaurants looked expensive. We paid approximately $175 a night to stay here when all of the taxes were included and it was peak season. One minor complaint was that the beach wasn't within walking distance unless you wanted to walk approximately a mile. The desk staff were very friendly and had excellent suggestions re. day trips, beaches, parking, etc. There was a computer available 24/7 near the front desk which was usually available and my son said the internet service in the room worked well for his computer.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Stringbean57
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and had a relaxing night stay at the Courtyard Marriott Miramar before we caught our plane home. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable. They keep this hotel lobby freezing! We turned off our ac in our room and opened the window and was very comfortable. Not much to see or do in the generally vicinity of the hotel. I had a quick sandwich at the Subway nearby before we went to the airport. It was an OK stay but since it was free with Marriott points I canâ€™t complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you buy on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: geekgal
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for $65. Clean spacious room w/view of the harbor Friendly staff. Great restaurant "Lima" just down the street. San Juan is a metropolis, so there are homeless on the street, but we felt very safe on this major street. You can take the bus to Old San Juan or Condado. or a taxi for $12.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation and can walk to old San Juan but avoid the din at night”
Reviews.Author: KerryBorn
Reviews.Content: The good: price, location, size of room, cleaniness The neighbourhood is nice. There are several shops and restaurants close to the Hotel. It is a short walk to the Caribe Hilton. From there you can walk along a spectacular coastline (public park and beach). It takes about 35 mins to walk all the way to Old San Juan. We rated the beach walk as one of the highlights of our trip to Puerto Rico. The two others were: the Rain Forest and Old San Juan (which is far superior to the French Quarter in New Orleans) The rooms were a good size - many San Juan hotels have surprisingly small rooms. The rooms were very comfortable and had everything one would need. The decor was pretty boring. Minor annoyance. Inquired ahead of time as to when we could check-in and were told 2pm. Arrived at hotel at 2:40 and were told that we must wait for the 3 pm. check in time. When we mentioned that we had been told 2 pm. the response was 'You must have talked to the 1-800 number not to us.' and we were then ignored until 3 pm rolled around. Other than this minor annoyance the help and service we received from the Puerto Rican people was exceptional. Everybody went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: GaShawnee
Reviews.Content: Five members of our company stayed with this hotel for 4 weeks. They are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and location is great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Relax after a Day of Work but great for vacations too.”
Reviews.Author: SalesKing
Reviews.Content: I arrived Monday 28 September to start work with my distributors Tuesday through Friday 2 October. I stayed an extra day, Saturday to take advantage of the Friday night Night Life. The hotel is very pretty, extremely clean and excellently located for business travellers. Additionally, if your on a vacation and want to do it less expensively it's not far from some of the hotels located in the Night Life Area which are almost twice the price. The best part are the staff who are totally bilingual and exceptionally cordial. I do not remember all the names but I will say that Maggy (nick-name) at the front desk really stands out. Not only did she go out of her way to help me (I witnessed with other guests as well) she has an enthusiastic effervescent personality. She will be one of the people I will remember on my next business trip. The restaurant is outstanding. The food is great, service is exceptional but again I can only remember Eduardo's name who among others went out of this way to help me and other diners out.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the price - San Juan is expensive!”
Reviews.Author: JeniKB
Reviews.Content: We bid on this room with priceline (I think the Marriott site charges almost twice per night what we paid). It's a nice hotel in a rather random area but the room was beautiful and the AC was excellent. We stayed here the night before taking a Princess cruise. There didn't seem to be much to do in Miramar but the bus can take you to Old San Juan easily for 75 cents. Our cab ride to/from the airport was around $14, fairly reasonable we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay more then $90.00 a night”
Reviews.Author: travellyf
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan this September and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I got the hotel through priceline for $90.00 a night. I first thought it was a bargin but upon arrival I felt as if i had over paid. The hotel is small located on a very small property. At first i thought it was desinged more for the business traveler but then upon seeing their business center ( 1 computer & 1 printer) I realize the hotel was just an extremely small hotel. The rooms are small but very clean. Infact the entrie place was very well kept and clean. The restaurants are insulting with their prices (hamburger $16.00). The pool is small and hot heated. The neighborhood during the day is charming and welcoming, however do not walk the streets at night as they become full of prostitutes, homeless and small groups of teenagers. It is much safer to spend the $20.00 for a cab then to walk anywhere after dark. The hotel is not well situated for visitors; it's far from old san juan & the beaches which makes having a rental car a must if you don't want to spend $20.00 for a cab one way. I would recommed this hotel if 1. your stay does not exceed 2 nights 2. you pay less then $80.00 a night for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Way beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: leep1987Atlanta
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline for 3 nights as the end to vacation time we spent elsewhere on the island and just wanted a good, clean place to stay as base to do some San Juan sightseeing and we were pleasantly surprised! The rooms were very nice and comfortable, as well as the beds. We had a king bed in our room, and as noted in another review - there is a slight tightness between the bed and the dresser, but nothing that is too bad. I have to say that the best thing about our stay was the staff: beyond friendly and helpful!! Everyone we encountered asked if we needed anything and if everything was ok. Maggie at the front desk was the most friendly, helpful, informative, and just happy person I have EVER encountered at a hotel. She provided us with alot of details about the hotel, the city, how the bus works, restaurants to go to (La Bombonera in Old San Juan on San Francisco Street is a must - especially the "mallorca" pastry/sandwich), and anything else we could have needed to know. The staff and hotel gave us a perfect ending to our vacation before heading home. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, even at twice the price we got through priceline!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short term stay”
Reviews.Author: EPguy4
Reviews.Content: We got a room here for just one night by bidding with Priceline. Our stay was short but nice. We found it to be a fine place for one night, clean, a short drive from the airport, and a decent restaurant. I wouldn't stay here for a whole vacation, but you will be fine here for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Better check twice before staying here..”
Reviews.Author: 1DayMrsL
Reviews.Content: I went with my family and the location to this hotel is in condado pr. And if you dont have a car rental or know someone that can direct you where to go its not much vacation. the restauraut downstairs is very expensive and small portions. The Pool is much smaller than shown in the picture The rooms are clean and spacious. My best advise on going to puerto rico is rent a car in advance and notice that the car rental policy is full amount including deposit our car rental was about $500 for the week. But dont take the tours that they offer you and company for that matter they will take for your money just rent a car and go to the beaches and Yunque for yourself its FREE. with tour operators its about $150 p/p. Great weather... But trust me when i say that resorts are better to go to in puerto rico..

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel, ruined our Vacation! Dont Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rico_ysl
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed here last year, and i never botherd to write a review but after reading some of the reviews i thought i would make sure people know what happened to us. For the first 10 days of our stay everything went fine. Staff would bring us up bottles of wine/champage. What a nice gesture! Wrong they must have been caseing out the room. 10 nights into our 14 night stay we returned to find our room robbed, gone our camcorder, gone our clothes, gone our camera, gone our sunglasses, gone our watch, gone our freakin souvenirs!!!!! who steals someone's souvenirs?? they even took memory cards!!!!! the front desk couldnt even care less, they refused to call the police, we had to get the restaurant to call the police. they hotel never offered a simple sorry. Oh wait we got a free piece of cake for the morning of my friends birthday after the night we got robbed. Also the pool at the restaurant.. is very plain, no waiter service and barely gets any sun and all the sunbathing gets interrupted by the contast traffic and whatever outside. the best part of the hotel is the casual restaurant....room service comprised of flirtatious waitors, ones who after delivering the food, look at me and said anything else you need while placing a hand on my shoulder! very odd... now i know this is a 3.5 star and we stayed here to save money, but after we spent the trip looking at other resorts... please spend just a little bit more for other resorts..such as the hilton, the normany, even the other marriot or the san juan water and beach club in Isla Verde.. the place to be if you like the beach! Being robbed always leaves a bad taste..but after no effort was ever made by the hotel to offer condolenses to us or simply any empathy, i will always tell people about the poor service...oh wait the beds were soft..forgot about that!

Reviews.Title: “awsome staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanleblanc
Reviews.Content: I can't believe people can criticize this hotel. I'ts not a 5 star, but a very well deserved 3.5. Those uppity people should be well aware that other hotel in the area can cater to there uppity standards, for a price of course. At $65 per night (priceline), this hotel is by far the best deal in town. The staff are always greeting you with a ravishing Puerto Rican smile, the hotel lobby is charming, the rooms well-appointed and the location convenient. For a $0.50 fare, you can jump on a transit bus to every part of the city, altough it may get a bit crowded at times. Our favorite destination was Old San Juan, this is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean; Grrrrreat Staff; Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: msosaChicago
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my "senior" mother on what was to be her return to Puerto Rico after a 53-year absence. We stayed at this Courtyard Marriott on the final leg of our trip (5/24-5/28.) I made all the travel arrangements and simply "rolled the dice" by choosing this hotel. Well, we came up winners. This hotel is located in a wonderfully diverse neighborhood. You have shops, restaurants, and even a supermarket down the street. We walked (45mins) to Viejo San Juan. Or you could take a 10min (50 cent) bus ride to Viejo San Juan. There is a wonderful harbor with great vistas just a block away. Our room, as well as all the public areas, were immaculate. The best thing of our stay was our interaction with the wonderful staff. They are curtious, helpful, and seemed to really enjoy what they do. I believe a staff with "bad" attitudes can absolutely ruin what was an otherwise great stay. This was not the case, here. Everyone, from the bell-hop to the housekeeper were a joy to see each day. WE ARE ALREADY PLANNING TYO RETURN.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: relayer
Reviews.Content: We booked the Courtyard through Priceline for $50. This was a pre-cruise stay on Easter weekend. The only thing I didn't like was the charge for parking (we had a rental car). One doesn't really have a choice with the parking. The hotel's location is good if you are embarking from the Pan Am Pier. That is a short ride away. The room was kind of small, as others have noted. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had no problems sleeping and our floor was quiet. I found the internet was very fast for a hotel, that was a big plus. We did not eat at the restaurant. I would not want to stay here if your destination is the beach or Old San Juan. It's not really within walking distance to anything. Yes, there are some restaurants and a supermarket down the street, but that's it. The staff was friendly and the hotel was pleasant to be in. I would have no problems staying here again for a pre-cruise stay, especially for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: IMAJerry
Reviews.Content: It is about a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport and it cost $17.00 one way plus a $1.00 tip per bag. The property is located in a neighborhood/business area, very quiet. There is a Walgreens about 3 blocks and a Subway 1 block away on the same street. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It is a no frills hotel, with one elevator. As reported in previous posts a long wait for the elevator, we did not have that experience. During our stay we did not have time to use the pool, but it is small. The workout facility had 1 exercise bike, a few weights and a treadmill. As for check-in we arrived around 3:00pm the lobby was empty and everything went smoothly. We used express check-out when leaving which meant no stopping at the front desk. Our departure was around 10:00am and it was getting busy in the lobby area. The rooms are clean and average size with refrigerators. Beds were very comfortable. Free in room internet access which worked fine for us. This is a good place for a tourist who does not spend much time in their room. The bus stop is 1 block from the hotel, it cost 75 cents and takes about 15 minutes to get to Old San Juan. A cab ride is approximately $12.00 one way to Old San Juan and it takes about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: trinity912
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott San Juan Miramar in April 2009 and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very nice and tried to be as helpful as possible. There is a computer and printer in the lobby that guest can use free of charge which we used to print out our boarding passes for our return trip home.The room came equipped with a refrigerator and was very clean, the fridge came in handy because there is a market a block away. There is a restaurant about two block away called Los Pinos which is open 24 hours and has decent food at low prices.There are also two buses that run down the street from the hotel which goes to old San Juan ( a fifteen minute ride). One bus costs 50 cent and the other costs 75 cents. I did not rent a car and I got around just fine on the bus. Once you get to Old San Juan, there is a trolley that runs all through Old San Juan that you can ride free of charge! We hopped on and off that thing every time we rode by something cool. There are also two small beaches which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel. We had a blast in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Get a Receipt”
Reviews.Author: jlbrain
Reviews.Content: I reserved 3 rooms for one night pre-cruise. They were all prepaid on Priceline. The hotel requires a credit card number for incedentals upon check-in. When I checked out, I was told there were no other charges, but didn't recieve a final printed billing. When I got home there was a charge on my credit card for $123!! There was no explanation from the hotel, which on the bill was "Hotel Excelcior", (my call was never returned), and I had to report it to the credit card company as fraud. It's been over a month and they still haven't refunded the money. The cc company wanted a receipt showing I didn't owe anything and I didn't have one...so...require one when you check out! The rooms were nice, the restaurants overpriced, and the neighborhood dangerous after dark...not much to do in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, But There Were Up's & Down's”
Reviews.Author: RobFranny10
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott San Juan Miramar in Mid-March 2009. We actually found this hotel through Priceline.com with a bid of just $89 dollars a night. Who could go wrong with that with a rate usually close to atleast $200+. When we arrived late night (around 11:30pm; Cab Ride was $18 from the Airport) the front desk was very polite and helpful. We got to our room after a quick check-in and fell right asleep (I must say the beds are extremely comfortable and clean). However, the next day when we went down to the Lobby it was completely swamped (around 10:30am) and took us nearly 45 minutes just to speak with someone at the Front Desk. The Male Manager there (I don't remember his name) was EXTREMELY helpful with getting us around and even gave us an umbrella because of the sun-showers. However, the only problems we had were the room not being made at nearly 4:00pm when we returned and the RUDE waiters downstairs in the Hotels Resturant. (DO NOT get RIPPED off inside the Resturant, the prices for food is an insult, $8.00 for a Brownie and $19 for a Burger with some fries??!!) Last but not least, the horrfic elevator. I waited nearly 15 minutes a few occasions just to get to the Lobby!! The pool was OK, very small with not much room if theres anymore then 10 people out there. Now, I must say if you don't enjoy walking this is !!NOT!! the place for you as it's located a good distance from the actually fun/night spots in Old San Juan. ($15 cab ride) and about a 20 minute walk to a beach. (You also need to cross a large highway to get the beach which is very unsafe, especially with children) There are a few fast food places directly a block away (Dominos, Papa Johns, Subway etc.) and also a very convient supermarket. The actually city the hotel is located in (Miramar) seems to be somewhat safe at night. I wouldn't want to walk alone though if I didn't have to. A major downside was the amount of homeless people sleeping on the streets (and also begging for change) a block or two from the hotel. Overall, for the price I got on Priceline for $89 a night I really can't complain. But if your spending anything over that I would go somewhere else! The location isn't very convinent and you'll end up spending a bunch for cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, loud elevator, marginal rooms”
Reviews.Author: jbcarron
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself isn't that bad, but for the money, I am sure you could find a better place and pocket some dollars. Average room rate was about $200. I stayed the first night of my trip, and the last night. Major overall concern was the sound of the elevators. You could hear them going up and down from the room. At first I thought it was planes flying low, then maybe stormy waves crashing against the shore in the distance...then I realized it was just the elevators. Basically they sounded like a rollercoaster. It was managable, but as far as the cost of the room, I could have found a better room elsewhere. Bring your own Shampoo, as they don't supply the bathrooms with any. Also the last night we stayed there, rooms had a very strong mildew/smoky odor. Not exactly pleasant. If I return to San Juan, I will look into other options. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NomeMan
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel, and well worth the price I paid at Priceline for it. Very clean rooms, but small. Great location in Miramar. Too far to walk to the beach, but centrally located for most of the San Juan area, and close to the convention center. (7/10)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet for pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: barefoot14
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel prior to a cruise. We got it on Priceline and at first were a bit hesitant. We got over that quickly and would definitely stay there again. Per another review, we requested a room not near the elevators. Within two blocks there is a very nice supermarket that sells liquor and wine and prepared foods, a movie theatre with 3 different shows (we paid $4.00 each to see Slumdog Millionaire), numerous restaurants including Vesuvio's Cafe which specializes in paella, Los Pinos Cafe (a neighborhood restaurant open 24 hours with super $3.00 breakfasts), along with Domino's, Papa John's, Subway and a taco restaurant.
