There are two fine dining restaurants in the hotel but we found them too expensive. We shared a meal in one of them and it was very good, however. The hotel has free Internet access in the rooms, a courtesy computer in the lobby, and is located in a quiet business/residential neighborhood. The bus stop is close by if you want to go to Old Town and cabs are always out front. The only negative thing was when all the cruisers arrived, elevator access was slow. There is only one elevator. My husband used the service elevator when he felt like he had waited long enough. Also there's a nice swimming pool where we hung out, hardly anyone there. We ordered drinks and appetizers by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay- good location”
Reviews.Author: ylcalvert
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was in a good location to get to the cruise pier, Old San Juan, and the airport. Taxi's were a flat rate of approximately $15 to the cruise pier and the airport. There is a $1 charge for each piece of luggage. There is a bus pickup 1/4 of a block away from the hotel. It is a 5 minute bus ride to Old San Juan (which is a must see for any traveler). The M1 or the A5 will take you there for 50-75 cents and you must have exact change. Plan on spending 2 days in Old San Juan: 1 day for shopping (check out the Butterfly People, the Brewery, and Island Essentials as well as name brands stores such as Coach, Tommy Hilfiger, etc - also there is plenty of duty free jewelry but know a good price and be ready to haggle) and 1 day for learning about the forts and the island's history. Upon checking in you will be charge $11 (they will tell you this will be returned to you upon checking out). I didn't understand why but I didn't argue about it and the $11 was returned to me. If you pre-order breakfast at the Marriott do not leave your waiter a tip - the hotel charges you $3 per person upon checking out. Also, there was a great restaurant about 1/2 block away called Lima's. The menu is in Spanish but there are several English speaker waiters who are friendly and will take their time explaining what everything is. The food there was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great Font Desk But That's It!”
Reviews.Author: VacationDude
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here post-cruise with wife and some friends of ours. The location is close enough to the bus stop to get to Old San Juan, but otherwise nothing doing at this place. The pool is shaded and VERY small. The lobby is the size of an apartment. There is no casino either. The room was spacious aside from the tiny bathroom, but lacked a feeling of new and/or quality. For example, they have an old, motel-like T.V. in the room we stayed in. Guessing same in every room. The only thing that stood out was the excellent front desk assistance. They really try hard to deliver even though they gave us the wrong directions. I think there are better places even for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to drop after or before cruise”
Reviews.Author: goshan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night after the cruise, and we found the hotel suitable for that purpose. There is a bus stop close to the hotel where buses A1 and A5 stop, and they will take you to old San Juan (50 and 75 cents, respectively). We had dinner at Los Pinos restaurant - it is quite casual but we enjoyed the food. The room itself was very spacious and clean, and the bathroom was large as well. The taxi to the airport is about 20$ plus $1 per luggage bag. Overall, we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: Rigafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott for just one night in mid-December on our way back from a truly great holiday on St Croix, the US Virgin Islands. After a 10-day holiday on the private quiet beach, San Juan truly seemed vibrant and noisy and we weren't exactly thrilled about the fact that the holiday was over and that we'd soon have to return to all the snow at home. However, the hotel staff was so nice to us, so it made our last day a little more bearable. The rooms were nice and clean, the bathroom was good as well, and there's even a little pool out there by the restaurant, so it was all good and we liked our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Well managed, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Miramar for two nights in early December. I enjoyed my stay for several reasons: 1) the hotel staff were exceptionally courteous and helpful, 2) the room was exceptionally clean and well cared for; I couldn't find anything to complain about, 3) the restauraunt served an excellent breakfast which was either buffet style or off the menu style, 4) the restaurant converted to a French style restaurant in the evening and was excellent in quality although somewhat pricey. My only minor complaint was the location of the hotel made it a bit difficult to find at night and I did not feel comfortable going out by foot at night. Old San Juan and other points of interest required a taxi to reach. Ratewise I felt the hotel was fairly priced; I paid about $140/night after having booked the reservation through the Marriott website and choosing the "Senior Rate" (62 years or older). I am returning to San Juan in January and will be staying at the Courtyard Marriott Miramar once again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Pre/Post Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAJ790HAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property before and after a 7-night Royal Caribbean cruise on board Adventure of the Seas. We arrived two days before the cruise because I'd read that flying into San Juan the day of embarkation was not recommended. We got a great price per night due to our travel agent arranging a group rate. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. We arrived for our pre-cruise stay about 3 PM. Check-in was quick and pleasant. The rooms are average size for a Courtyard property. Everything was very clean and well maintained. I learned that Marriott had recently purchased and renovated the hotel. My only complaints about the room were its proximity to the elevator shaft. You could hear the elevator whooshing up and down all-night long! Also, the room was EXTREMELY COLD!!!!!! There was no thermostat to attempt to warm things up a bit! Alas, the price paid for vacationing where it never gets cold! There was a restaurant in the hotel, but it was very expensive. There are numerous places to eat within walking distance of the hotel. One place recommended by the staff was the Los Pinos restaurant, about 3 blocks from the hotel. Frankly, the food or the staff did not impress me. My steak sandwich was so tough; I could have soled my shoes with it! The wait staff pretty much ignored us until I complained to management. There are other places nearby (Papa John's Pizza, a Pueblo supermarket (a huge chain supermarket in Puerto Rico) and more!) So, you need not pay those extravagant prices at the hotel restaurant if you don't want to! There is also a U.S. Post Office across the street. I mailed the cruise souvenirs home, thus avoiding the airport hassle of extra baggage! Public transportation is plentiful and cheap. Several bus lines just outside the hotel get you to Old San Juan for just 50 cents. As far as security was concerned, I felt completely safe walking around the area at night. Like any place else, just use a little common sense and avoid areas that even look like they may be trouble. Our post-cruise stay of one night was great! Our cruise ship arrived in San Juan at 7 AM. We were off the ship by 10 AM. We expected a long wait for our room. But, we were pleasantly surprised when our room was ready so early in the day! During the post-cruise stay, we took advantage of the small laundry room in the basement. We washed up the dirty clothes accumulated during the cruise. So, we had all clean clothing to pack for the final journey home the next afternoon. I would highly recommend this hotel. In fact, if we take a non-cruise trip to San Juan in the future, we may just stay at this Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to use as a base for taking in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaHawkeye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located so it is within a few minutes drive to all the San Juan landmarks. However, the closest beach is the Condado public beach, which is a 20-25 minute walk. You will have to drive to the other beaches. If you want a comfortable, updated, well-staffed, well-located hotel that you want to use as a base for planning your days in Puerto Rico, this is a great choice. If you want to have easy access to the beach every day, it is not a good choice. The staff is really polite and acommodating. The room we had was modern, updated, has a small refrigerator, and a complimentary internet connection. The bed and linens were very comfortable. We did not eat at the overpriced hotel restaurants and opted to eat at four different cheap, but good, local puerto rican restaurants within a five block walk of the hotel. There is a grocery store, pharmacy, and gas station within two blocks of the hotel (very handy for getting water, snacks, meds, and gas for rental car). There is a Papa Johns, Subway, Dominos, and Taco Maker also within a couple blocks. The hotel has easy access to the main highways to quickly get to your destination. A couple negatives is that the hotel only has valet parking ($15/day), one elevator for guests, and the gym is small (one treadmill, one eliptical, one bike, and free weights).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gagak
Reviews.Content: I'd give this a 3.5 rating. If you're looking for a beach resort, this ain't it. A central location for trips around the island-it is. And at a good price. We stayed here for one night pre-cruise and 3 nights post-cruise. A 2-room king suite with refrigerator each time for about $160 per night. The rooms were clean and modern. The first afternoon we had no hot water, but it was hot by that evening. Unlike other reviewers, I found this hotel to be conveniently located if you rent a car and do sightseeing--it's one block from a main highway and is also located on a major street. 15 minutes from the airport, 15 minutes in the other direction from Old San Juan and cruise port. 5 minutes to Condado and Isla Verde and those tourist areas. It's not a resort neighborhood; it is in a regular working neighborhood with a wide array of people. From beggars to schoolchildren to working people, to the office buildings, to the $700,000 condos going up across the street. A bus route also passes the hotel. Across the street or within a couple of blocks of the hotel were several local restaurants (with excellent food!), Walgreens, Marshalls, Rainbow (Ladies' clothing), Subway, Pueblo supermarket (PR chain), a couple of pharmacies that were more like mega convenience stores, a dollar store, the post office, a gas station and more. None of them were charging tourist prices. A block away, next to the highway was also a large lagoon that we and others walked and jogged alongside. On the other side of the lagoon was the Condado area. The hotel staff was wonderful. We had good experiences with the valet, the front desk, the bellman, the housekeeper. We did not use the onsite restaurant, though we heard it was one of the best in San Juan, but out of our price range for this vacation. There is a small jewelry store and mini(no I mean really, really tiny) mart in the lobby. The valet made arrangements for the car rental agency to pick us up to get our rental. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great time. A nice spot to be in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RobbleRobble
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here just this weekend and I wanted to share what a positve experience we had. The Courtyard Marriot, Miramar is located in the business center of San Juan I read many reviews commenting that this was a poor location. For our needs we found that far from the case. Is it beachfront? No...but neither is the price. We got a room here on Priceline for under a "Ben Franklin" considering the price it is VERY tough to beat. By the location, this property caters more to the business set than the tourist type. For us this was a good thing. What it means for you is you get a clean, well aportioned and QUIET place to sleep in a very busy city. Those who want to be out till 4AM drinking will likely not apprecate this hotel as it is not in walking distance to the myriad of bars in Condado or Old San Juan. For this rest of us, this is a fantastic place to be. For those with a car, there is valet parking at the property - $15 a night. We were quite lucky and found parking on the steet each night. For those without a vehicle, there is a bus stop less than a half block away that will take you to Old San Juan, Condado, or wherever else you want to go. We found the neighborhood to be safe and well lit (a mixed residential / business area) As for the property - a recent major renovation has given this property a very sharp appearance both inside and out. Expect the typical Courtyard by Marriot color scheme. The common areas were very clean - with nice marble accents and a free business center with a computer for use by the guests. Check-in was very quick and the staff very pleasant. This property is a bit atypical for a Courtyard Marriot as there is not a true Courtyard per say. There is a small pool at the property and one of the best restaurants in all San Juan (very formal). Our room was a king sized room on the 11th floor. We had a partial view of the lagoon which was a nice touch. As for the room itself it was quite well apportioned - all the usuals you would expect - largre comfortable bed, a business desk and side chair and a standard 25" TV. The TV was only so-so, but how often do you just hang out in the room to watch TV? The carpets and furniture were new and the carpets fresh with no visible wear. The bathroom was apportioned with marble floors and counters and fresh paint and new modern lighting. Water pressue was very good (sometimes a problem in San Juan) and there was ample hot water as well. All in all - We have no complaints with the hotel at all. Frankly I question where some of the folks with negative reviews stayed, as this was well beyond our expecations. AAA gives this property 2 diamonds, and priceline calls this property 2 1/2 stars, I would I would give this property a solid 3 1/2 stars. We have stayed in many AAA 3 diamond hotels that were not half as nice as this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: chris.r.copeland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to rate. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are nicely updated and things just look professional. The valet parking works well. I hear the restaurant is very popular, but way too expensive for me to try myself. The problems were these: 1) Didn't have any hot water for my first 5 nights (but its an issue they have now fixed), 2) The regular restarant is closed and undergoing construction, 3) The street on which this hotel is located is very bad. Expect to have to walk through areas crowded with bums and other miscreants on the way to the closest food (Subway). I would say this place is good if you are staying a one or just a few days. I would not stay here long, and I would never suggest this hotel for a single woman travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: miketp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to our cruise. We chose it because it was close to the harbor, only 5 minutes by taxi. First the good things about it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we inquired about eateries within walking distance the bellman recommended Los Cafe Pinos. We ate there and the food was very good and the prices reasonable. It is a neighborhood restaurant not a tourist place. One warning though, if you don't speak Spanish communicating with the waitress can be a problem. The room at the hotel was clean and comfortable and fine for a night. We had no problems with check-in but checkout was very slow. It was Easter weekend and lots of pre-cruise guests trying to checkout but they only had one clerk on duty. The negatives were few in our experience. The hotel lost power briefly was was corrected . Our room was nonsmoking but every time the air came on it brought the smell of cigarette smoke into the room. The restaurants are very pricey. We attempted to eat breakfast before checkout but walked out without it. The hostess ignored the line and chatted with a group of locals at their table. A couple leaving told us that service was nonexistent and plan to be there at least two hours.

Reviews.Title: “O.k for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: mjs11505
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for 5 days/4 nights. Check in was a breeze. Room was very spacious and clean, but still cold even though the thermostat was on warm. After a couple of days there, the maid service showed up, while we were still in the room and we let her come in to do her job. Right before our very eyes, she picked up our glasses and rinsed them out in the bathroom. We were shocked and asked her for clean glasses, but she didn't speak english. No apologies were given. With the price we paid to stay there, we expected better. The valet parking was very good and informative. You will need to rent a car or take a taxi to see tourist areas. There are several places to eat in the area. Next time I will definitely pay a little more for a better hotel close to the beach and in a better area where you can feel safe walking at night. We would have been better off staying in Condado or Isla Verde. Also upon checkout, we ended up being charged for our full stay, even though 1 night was susposed to be free, we used our Marriott Points when booking and the hotel couldn't do anything about it, even though we showed them in writing. They said they never received anything from their home office.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard San Juan Miramar - Expect long check-in process and wait”
Reviews.Author: Peregrinator_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in this hotel the day before (a Saturday) our cruise on the Royal Caribbean. This hotel was ok, but did have a share of problems. The CONS 1) EXPECT long wait for your room! Check-in time to this hotel is 3pm. We arrived at this hotel around 4pm and our room was not ready yet. We had booked 2 rooms. 1 for my husband and I (3rd floor). The other room for my in-laws (11th floor). It nearly took 1 hour before we were given our room key which was not good considering we just got in from a 5 hour flight and had to wait at the SJU airport an hour for our luggage to come out of baggage claim...which is another story. 2) The lights in the room are very dim so you'll have a hard time seeing things in the dark, if you needed to. 3) My in-laws room's (11th floor) air conditioning was not working properly. It was way too cold in the room and the thermostat control was set to the warm side. 4) There is only 1 elevator. The time we stayed, it was out of order, so we had to use the service elevator while it was being fixed 5) Far from the beach. If you want to be close to the beach, it's not in walking distance, you'll need to take a taxi or public bus. The PROs 1) If you just need an overnight stay just for a cruise close (1 mile) to the PAN American Pier where Royal Caribbean ships are docked, the hotel is not bad. 2) The hotel workers were very friendly and informative. They allowed us to keep our luggage in their storage after we checked out. That gave us the ability to see Old San Juan and the Morro Fort 3) Taxis are always available 4) Room was very clean with good decor and comfortable bed 5) Close to Papa John's, Subway, Movie theatre, Dominos, and local puerto rican restaurant. There also is a small bistro at the hotel. So all in all if the wait to get our room was faster, I would have rated this higher. If you want to stay more than 1 day, I wouldn't recommend it. If we go back to San Juan, we probably would try closer to Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I think I will stay at the Marriott Next time”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: To begin the staff was very nice and friendly. They allowed us to leave our luggage after check out while we went shopping before our cruise was to leave out that evening, I cannot say enough about the staff. As for the hotel, it was OK. The bed was comfortable and the room itself was pretty clean. I liked the bathroom until I looked up and saw where part of the ceiling looked to have been leaking alot and the tub has some issues with some mold. I think it is because this building was an old building that had been renovated. I could see where when the painters painted, they just painted over the hinges, etc in the room. I noticed this inside and outside the room. As for the area, it was pretty dead. I think that is because iti was more or less a business district and we were there on the weekend. I will say the room was very quiet. If you are looking for a view, there really isn't one. If I had to do it again and considering how expensive this Courtyard was, I would rather pay the extra money and book at the Marriott in the Condado.
